subject: Education
title: John Dewey: Learning by Doing
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on John Dewey: Learning by Doing.

hook.text: John Dewey said: 'Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself.' He wanted schools that felt like

buildup.text: Dewey founded the progressive education movement in the 1890s. He believed learning happens through experience

discovery.text: At his Laboratory School in Chicago, children learned science by gardening, math by cooking, and history by building.

twist.text: Many schools claimed to follow Dewey but just removed structure entirely. Dewey himself criticized this: freedom

climax.text: Dewey's insight endures: the best learning connects to real life. Students learn most deeply when they see why

punchline.text: He didn't say 'let kids do whatever they want.' He said 'make what they do

quiz.question: What is the core principle of Dewey's educational philosophy?
options: Learning happens through experience, inquiry, and connection to real life
